alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 1:00AM EDT until July 06 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following counties, Fairfield, Franklin OH and Licking. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1259 AM EDT, Radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Northern Franklin, southwest Licking and Northern Fairfield Counties. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Pickerington, Worthington, Bexley, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Canal Winchester, Groveport, West Jefferson, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake and Hebron.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
